summary: Robert C Morrison was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents list his position, annual salary, and gross pay for various accounting periods. The documents suggest he was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Robert C Morrison's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates his involvement in the HSCA's operations during its investigation.
